sentences.en: I don't react anymore when opponents try to niggle me.
sentences.cn: 对手找茬惹我时，我不会再理他们。

sentences.en: I realise now that the things which used to niggle and annoy me just don't really matter.
sentences.cn: 我现在意识到那些曾令我烦恼不快的事情其实无关紧要。

sentences.en: It niggles me that we can’t go home yet and get warm.
sentences.cn: 我很生气，我们到现在还不能回家暖和暖和。

sentences.en: So why is there a little niggle at the back of my mind?
sentences.cn: 那为什么我潜意识里会有一丝不安呢?

sentences.en: Something’s been niggling her all day.
sentences.cn: 有什么事烦了她一整天。

sentences.en: Surely, I thought, the Messiah himself - if he should ever come - won't niggle over nickels and dimes.
sentences.cn: 毫无疑问, 我想即使弥赛本人出面,他也不会如此铁面无私.

sentences.en: The life we have built together is more important than any minor niggle either of us might have.
sentences.cn: 咱们共同建立的生活要比你我各自可能会有的任何小小的不满重要。

sentences.en: You tend to niggle at your partner, and get hurt when he doesn't hug you.
sentences.cn: 你往往会对伴侣吹毛求疵，如果他不拥抱你，就感到受了伤害。

words.tran_cn: 为琐事操心的；过于精细的；琐碎的
过于琐碎的工作；无关紧要的事
拘泥小节；为琐事费时；挑剔

trans.tran_cn: 轻微的批评；小牢骚,一丝挥不去的烦恼（或疑虑等）,轻微疼痛
为琐事费心, 拘泥小节
trans.tran_en: if something niggles you, you keep worrying about it or feeling annoyed about it and you cannot forget it

trans.tran_cn: 为小事操心，吹毛求疵，不断地烦扰
